Lincoln Aviator 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Lincoln Aviator 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Lincoln Aviator changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Lincoln Aviator 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

It might be difficult to reproduce official Lincoln Aviator 0-60 times driving your own car, as measuring accuracy of Lincoln Aviator acceleration from 0 to 60 depends on the transmission type or such variables as wind, weather conditions, tire traction or even weight of the rim. For the safety of the public, 0-60 times are often recorded by professional drivers on the closed racing tracks or dragstrips.

The good news is you can always soup up your car to have the best drag times. The easiest way is chip-tuning. The Engine of Lincoln Aviator is equipped with an engine management system (EMS)/Engine Control Unit (ECU) which can be modified to different settings, producing different performance levels and boosting Aviator\'s horsepower.

Right now we are well on course to post the data on transmission and engine on the Lincoln Aviator acceleration page of our website. We also have plans to make it possible for any visitor of the website to add their own custom data on Lincoln Aviator acceleration.
